summary: This document is an email chain from August 21, 2019, regarding an update to the victim website for the Jeffrey Epstein case. It announces a court hearing ordered in connection with the proposed nolle prosequi order following Epstein's death, scheduled for August 27, 2019, before Judge Richard M. Berman.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses the legal proceedings following his death.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case in the Southern District of New York. He ordered the hearing scheduled for August 27, 2019.

events.title: Proposed Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order (a formal notice of abandonment of prosecution) to the Court following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Hearing Ordered
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman ordered a hearing in connection with the proposed nolle prosequi order. Victims and their counsel were invited to be heard.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Hearing
events.description: A hearing scheduled for 10:30 a.m. before Judge Berman at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse in New York to address the proposed abandonment of the prosecution.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document confirms the death of defendant Jeffrey Epstein prior to August 21, 2019.
Following Epstein's death, the U.S. Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order to formally abandon the prosecution.
Judge Richard M. Berman ordered a hearing to allow victims and their counsel to be heard regarding the proposed termination of the case.
The hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, at the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse in New York.
The correspondence is an administrative update to the victim website managed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
